remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback> event occurs when a drag-and-drop operation is started. The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback> event enables the source of a drag event to modify the appearance of the mouse pointer to provide the user with visual feedback during a drag-and-drop operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether default cursor feedback behavior should be used for the associated drag-and-drop operation.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicating whether default cursor feedback behavior should be used for the associated drag-and-drop operation. to use default feedback cursor behavior; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, the mouse cursor changes to provide feedback about permissible actions during a drag-and-drop operation.
